articles.title: Coronavirus: Third of those hospitalised with virus in UK dying, study suggests - The Independent
articles.description: ‘Some people persist in believing that Covid-19 is no worse than a bad dose of flu. They are gravely mistaken’, lead researcher says
articles.content:
A third of coronavirus patients admitted to hospital in the UK are dying, a study has suggested, with figures indicating the virus is just as deadly as Ebola for those forced to seek emergency medical treatment.

articles.author: Fraser Myers
articles.title: How the lockdown fuelled the care-homes crisis - Spiked
articles.description: The NHS has been discharging patients who may still have Covid back into care homes. This is madness.
articles.content: The daily death figures from hospitals have dominated the news headlines and the governments press briefings during Britains coronavirus crisis so far. Mercifully, those figures have been in decline for some time now. The peak of hospital deaths was passed on… [+4822 chars]

Britains coronavirus death toll rose by 17 per cent yesterday under a new method of reporting that casts doubt on suggestions that fatalities are falling. The figures, which include care homes for the first time, revealed that 26,097 people have died.
